# Draft:Guruji Shri Nandkishore Tiwari

Guruji Shri Nandkishore Tiwari (born 27 September 1969) is an Indian spiritual teacher, author, and former journalist, known as the founder of the Sahaj Smriti Yog system of meditation.
Career in journalism
Tiwari began his professional career in journalism, holding editorial roles for Hindi and English publications.
His collection of editorials, Pahle 52 Saptah, was published in 2015.
Spiritual teachings
Tiwari developed Sahaj Smriti Yog (also known as Pindodak Kriya), a meditation system intended to facilitate self-realisation through effortless remembrance.
According to academic Makarand R. Paranjape in the New Indian Express, the practice avoids "artificial, complex and cerebral" approaches, emphasising the necessity of direct experience and the role of a living guru.
Journalist Narayani Ganesh wrote in The Times of India that Tiwari’s teachings connect personal transformation with active social responsibility, framing spiritual practice as a means of improving both individual and collective well-being.
Public engagements
Tiwari has spoken at public forums, including spiritual conferences such as the Mahakumbh (2025).
His perspectives on Sanatana Dharma and spirituality have also appeared in Hindi national dailies such as Jansatta.
